metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8632 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The structured-clone implementation in Mozilla Firefox before 34.0 and SeaMonkey before 2.31 does not properly interact with XrayWrapper property filtering, which allows remote attackers to bypass intended DOM object restrictions by leveraging property availability after XrayWrapper removal.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8632` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 34.0
firefox-globalmenu - 34.0
firefox-mozsymbols - 34.0
firefox-testsuite - 34.0
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '34.0').
